get.description: InfoEndpoint returns basic information about Smart Proxy, Insights Results Aggregator, and Content Service version, utils repository version, commit hash etc.

get.summary: Read all metrics exposed by this service

Additionally it is possible to consume all metrics provided by Go runtime. These metrics start with go_ and process_ prefixes.

get.summary: Returns the latest report for the given cluster.
get.description: Report that is going to be returned is specified by its cluster IDs that is part of path.

parameters.name: get_disabled
parameters.description: If true, disabled rules will be sent too.

get.summary: Returns relevant information about the cluster available in AMS API.
get.description: Cluster ID is given in URL. Organization ID in token must match the one under which the cluster is registered in AMS.

schema.description: Response data type for GET /clusters/{clusterId}/info endpoint

display_name.description: An human-readable name for the cluster

managed.description: Indicates whether cluster is managed or not (has 'managed' flag in AMS)

status.description: Status of the cluster, such as Active, Deprovisioned, etc

400.description: Invalid request, usually caused when some cluster belongs to different organization.

404.description: Cluster info was not returned from AMS API for given organization.

get.description: Get a prediction of whether a cluster upgrade would fail.

200.description: Status ok

last_checked_at.description: [Optional] Last time of analysis for given cluster.

503.description: Status NotAvailable: happens when the AMS API or the Upgrade Risks Prediction service is not available.

get.summary: List of requests for given cluster
get.description:
Provides a list of all the recorded requests for the cluster with given ID, if any. Response should have following format:
```{
"cluster":"{clusterID}",
"requests":[{array}],
"status":"{string}"
}
```
Where {array} contains following objects:
```{
"requestID": {requestID},
"valid: True,
"received": {timestamp},
"processed": {timestamp},
}
```

200.description: List of requests available (last 24 hours) for the given organization and cluster and their status.

400.description: Invalid request (e.g cluster ID with unexpected format)

post.summary: Filtered list of stored requests for given cluster ID
post.description:
A list of requests for given cluster, filtered by the provided request IDs, if any. List of request IDs should be in format
```[
"requestID1",
"requestID2",
 ...,"requestID3"
]
```
Response is in format:
```{
"cluster": "{clusterID}"
"requests": [{array}]
"status": "{string}"
}
```
Where {array} contains the following objects:
```{
"requestID": {requestID},
"valid": true/false depends if this is valid/known request ID,
"received": {timestamp},
"processed": {timestamp},
}
```

200.description: List of requests available (last 24 hours) for the given organization and cluster and their status.

400.description: Invalid request (e.g cluster ID with unexpected format) or payload (empty body or not a list of strings)

404.description: Cluster ID not found or no requests found in storage for provided IDs

get.summary: Check status of a given cluster's request
get.description:
The status of the request with given ID if found. The cluster ID is required so only requests for the given cluster are returned, if any. Response should have the following format: ```
{
"cluster": "{clusterID}",
"requestID":"{requestID}",
"status": "{string}"
}
```

200.description: Stored status for the given cluster and request IDs

400.description: Invalid request or invalid cluster ID

404.description: Request ID or cluster ID not found

get.summary: Retrieve simplified reports for a given cluster and request IDs if available
get.description:
For the given cluster and request IDs, return the simplified report, if any. Response should have the following format:
```
{
"cluster": "{clusterID}",
"requestID": "{requestID}",
"status": "{string}",
"report": "{simplifiedReportStructure}",
}```
Where simplifiedReportStructure might look like:
```[
"rule_fqdn": "",
"error_key": "",
"description": "",
"total_risk": "",
]
```

200.description: Simplified report for given cluster and request IDs

400.description: Invalid request or invalid cluster ID

404.description: Cluster or request ID not found

200.description: A JSON object with the content.

get.summary: Returns a list recommendations and the number of clusters they're currently impacting.
get.description: The affected clusters are based on the requester's organization. If the AMS API is available, the clusters are pulled from there, otherwise we retrieve the clusters from our database.

parameters.name: impacting
parameters.description: If param is missing, endpoint will return all available rules including those that don't hit any clusters at the moment. If set to true, only returns impacting rules. If false, only returns those that aren't impacting.

200.description: Returns a list recommendations and the number of clusters they're currently impacting. Default behaviour is to return only the rules that affect atleast one cluster. This can be changed by passing impacting parameter

post.summary: Send the new rating for a given rule
post.description: Return the new rating. Any previous rating for this rule by this user is amended to the current value. This does not attempt to delete a rating by this user of thus rule if the rating is zero.

example.description: Introducing Insights for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform
example.details:
Red Hat Insights for OpenShift is a proactive management solution. It provides ongoing infrastructure analyses of your Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.2 and later installations. Red Hat Insights helps you identify, prioritize, and resolve risks to security, performance, availability, and stability before they become urgent issues.
Red Hat Insights for OpenShift uses the Remote Health Monitoring feature of OpenShift 4. The health checks are created by Red Hat subject matter experts and assessed according to severity and impact.
This is an example  recommendation that you can safely ignore. To disable it, click  the triple-dot menu button next to the header, and select Disable.

[Knowledgebase Article](https://access.redhat.com/search/#/knowledgebase)
